name: Regents of the University of California v. Bakke
question: Did the University of California violate the Fourteenth Amendment's equal protection clause, and the Civil Rights Act of 1964, by practicing an affirmative action policy that resulted in the repeated rejection of Bakke's application for admission to its medical school?
description: A case in which the Court found that any racial quota for the purpose of admissions supported by a government entity violates the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: United States v. Raddatz
question: Does the statute allowing the district court to decide a suppression motion based on a record and finding of facts developed by a magistrate judge violate the Constitution?

name: GTE Sylvania, Inc. v. Consumers Union of the United States, Inc.
Norfolk & Western Railway Company v. Liepelt
Consumer Product Safety Commission v. GTE Sylvania, Inc.
Central Machinery Company v. Arizona State Tax Commission
Board of Education of the City of School District of New York
Curtiss-Wright Corporation v. General Elec. Company
National Labor Relations Board v. Yeshiva University
Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press
Harris v. McRae
question: Did the Hyde Amendment violate the right to privacy, the Due Process Clause of the Fifth Amendment, or the Religion Clauses of the First Amendment?

name: Chiarella v. United States
question: Did Chiarella violate Section 10(b) of the 1934 Act by failing to disclose the impending takeover before trading in the target company's securities?

name: City of Rome v. United States
General Telephone Company of the Northwest, Inc. v. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission
Crowell v. Mader Judgment vacated and case remanded
Richmond Newspapers Inc. v. Virginia
question: Did the closure of the trial to the press and public violate the First Amendment or the Sixth Amendment?

name: Vance v. Universal Amusement Company, Inc.
Crown Simpson Pulp Company v. Costle
question: Did the court of appeals have jurisdiction over the permit review where the State of California was in charge of granting the permit?

name: Rush v. Savchuk
question: Can a state have jurisdiction over a defendant with no connections in the state by attaching the contractual obligation of an insurer licensed in the state?
description: A case in which the Court held that a state could not acquire jurisdiction over a defendant with no connections in the state by attaching the contractual obligation of an insurer licensed in the state?

name: Diamond v. Chakrabarty
question: Is the creation of a live, human-made organism patentable under Title 35 U.S.C. Section 101?

name: Strycker's Bay Neighborhood Council, Inc. v. Karlen
Dawson Chemical Company v. Rohm & Haas Company
National Labor Relations Board v. Retail Store Employees Union
McLain v. Real Estate Board of New Orleans, Inc.
United States v. Sioux Nation of Indians
question:
(1) Was Congress' 1978 amendment a violation of separation of powers?

(2) Was the reclamation of land in 1877 a taking of property requiring compensation under the Just Compensation Clause of the Fifth Amendment?

name: Mobil Oil Corporation v. Commissioner of Taxes of Vermont
World-Wide Volkwagen Corporation v. Woodson
question: May a state court exercise in personam jurisdiction over a non-resident defendant in a products liability action where the defendant’s only connection to the state is the accident in question?

name: Lewis v. BT Investment Managers, Inc.
Secretary of the Navy v. Huff
Village of Schaumburg v. Citizens for Better Environment
question: Was Schaumburg's ordinance "overbroad" and therefore in violation of the First and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Estes v. Metropolitan Branches of Dallas National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
Rhode Island v. Innis
question: Did the police "interrogation" en route to the station violate Innis's Miranda rights?

name: Exxon Corporation v. Department of Rev. of Wisconsin
United States Parole Commission v. Geraghty
California Retail Liquor Dealers Assn. v. Midcal Aluminum, Inc.
Walter v. United States
question: Is the warrantless projection of films a violation of the Fourth Amendment?

name: Williams v. Zbaraz
question:
(1) Did the district court have the jurisdiction to consider the constitutionality of the Hyde Amendment?

(2) Does the Hyde Amendment allow a state to limit its Medicaid funding of abortions to those specified by the Amendment?

name: Martinez v. California
question: Does a statute immunizing parole officials from injuries resulting from parole decisions violate the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that a statute immunizing parole officials from injuries resulting from parole decisions violate the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: Snepp v. United States
question: Were Snepp's First Amendment rights violated?

name: Catalano, Inc. v. Target Sales, Inc.
Seatrain Shipbuilding Corporation v. Shell Oil Company
Sears, Roebuck and Co. v. County of Los Angeles and City of Compton
question: Is the County of Los Angeles tax an unconstitutional regulation on interstate commerce?

name: Central Hudson Gas & Electric Corporation v. Public Service Commission of New York
question: Did the PSC's ban on advertising violate the freedom of speech protected by the First and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: United States v. California
question: Do man-made piers and islands qualify as "coast line" under the Submerged Lands Act of 1953?

name: Deposit Guaranty National Bank of Jackson v. Roper
Consolidated Edison Company of New York v. Public Service Commission of New York
United States v. Benmar Transp. & Leasing Corporation
Nachman Corporation v. Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation
Board of Regents of Univ. of State of N. Y. v. Tomanio
Reeves Inc. v. Stake
question: Did South Dakota's preferential system violate the Commerce Clause?

name: Fullilove v. Klutznick
question: Did the provision of the statute for minority business enterprises violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Washington v. Confederated Tribes of the Colville Indian Reservation
O'Bannon v. Town Court Nursing Center
Aaron v. SEC
question: Must the SEC prove that that the defendant intended to “deceive, manipulate, or defraud” in an action that alleges violations of Section 17(a) of the ’33 Act and Section 10(b) of the ’34 Act and Rule 10b-5?
description: A case in which the Court held that plain language and the legislative history of the statutes required the SEC to establish defendant’s intent to “deceive, manipulate, or defraud” for violations of Section 10(b) and the part of Section 17(a) that specifically refers to the use of a device, scheme, or artifice with intent to defraud.

name: National Labor Relations Board v. International Longshoremen's Association, AFL-CIO
Bloomer v. Liberty Mutual Insurance Company
Ohio v. Roberts
question: Does the introduction into evidence of prior testimony of a witness who had not been cross-examined violate the Sixth Amendment?

name: Idaho ex rel. Evans v. Oregon
American Export Lines, Inc. v. Alvez
question: May Alvez’s wife sue American Export Lines, Inc. for loss of consortium, as a result of AELI’s negligence and the unseaworthiness of the USS Export Builder, under federal maritime law?

name: Goldwater v. Carter
question: Did Congress have a constitutional role to play in the termination of the treaty?

name: PruneYard Shopping Center v. Robins
question: Did PruneYard's regulations violate the students' free speech rights?

name: Supreme Court of Virginia v. Consumers Union of the United States, Inc.
question:
Is the Supreme Court of Virginia immune from a suit brought under the Civil Rights Code of 1983?

Can the Supreme Court of Virginia be liable for attorney’s fees?

name: White Mountain Apache Tribe v. Bracker
Ybarra v. Illinois
question: Does the Illinois state statute that allows authorities to search persons on the premises during the execution of a valid search warrant violate the Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Committee for Public Education and Religious Liberty v. Regan
New York Gaslight Club, Inc. v. Carey
Rummel v. Estelle
question: Did Rummel's life sentence under the Texas recidivist law constitute cruel and unusual punishment in violation of the Eighth Amendment?

name: Ford Motor Credit Company v. Milhollin
Wengler v. Druggists Mutual Insurance Company
Godfrey v. Georgia
question: Is the Georgia law governing the death penalty “arbitrary and capricious” in violation of the Eighth Amendment?

name: Industrial Union Department, AFL-CIO v. American Petroleum Institute
question: Did the Secretary exceed his authority to set standards?

name: Hatzlachh Supply Company, Inc. v. United States
Thomas v. Washington Gas Light Company
Trammel v. United States
question: Is it a reversible error to permit a wife to be called as a witness against her husband over his objection and without his consent?
description: A case in which the Court held that it is not eversible error to permit a wife to be called as a witness against her husband over his objection and without his consent.

name: Carbon Fuel Company v. United Mine Workers of America
